frameDefinitions: An Asset is in a state where it is exposed to or otherwise liable to be affected by a Harmful_event, which may be metonymically evoked by reference to a Dangerous_entity.
In this frame a Traveler goes on a journey, an activity, generally planned in advance, in which the Traveler moves from a Source location to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.
An Artifact is deliberately made or modified by an intelligent entity to be put to a certain kind of Use.
Some Protection prevents a Danger from harming an Asset.
An Entity is in motion  at a particular Speed, a momentaneous description of distance traveled per time.

Commerce is a situation in which a Buyer and a Seller have agreed upon an exchange of Money and Goods (possibly after a negotiation), and then perform the exchange, optionally carrying it out with various kinds of direct payment or financing or the giving of change.
frameExamples: If you are a farmer, you are at <t>risk</t> for hearing loss caused by noise exposure in your work.
Ellen <t>journeyed</t> to Europe with five suitcases.
There are reports that Kim Il Sung asked China to share its nuclear weapons <t>technology</t>.
The rubber on her sneakers <t>protected</t> her from the mud.
listRoleDefinitions: Something judged to be desirable or valuable which might be lost or damaged.
An action that may occur or a state which may hold which could result in the loss of or damage to the <fen>Asset</fen>.
A concrete or abstract entity which may come to cause the loss of, or damage to the <fen>Asset</fen> either due to its participation in a <fen>Harmful_event</fen>.
The time period during which the <fen>Asset</fen> enjoys  the specified level of security from a <fen>Harmful_event</fen>.

A particular location in which the <fen>Asset</fen> is secure. Frequently, it is to be inferred that the characteristics of the location protect the <fen>Asset</fen> from a potential <fen>Harmful_event</fen>.

This is the <fen>Area</fen> in which the traveling takes place. This frame element describes the enclosed area inside which travelling, of unspecified <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the location where the travelers end up.
The <fen>Path</fen> is the route along which the travel takes place.
This is the living being which travels. Normally, the <fen>Traveler</fen> is expressed as an external argument.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the starting point of the trip.

The <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> expresses how the motion of the <fen>Traveler</fen> is effected, by their body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the <fen>Traveler</fen>. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'.
The direction in which the <fen>Traveler</fen> goes.
When the traveling occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location of the motion. It describes the area in which motion (with a specified <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) takes place.

This role identifies the entity or substance that is designed to have a particular <fen>Use</fen>. This can refer to physical artifacts, like a mug or computer monitor, or a digital artifact, such as a website or document.
The person, entity, or action that prevents harm to an <fen>Asset</fen>.
A situation that could damage the <fen>Asset</fen>.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protection</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
The time when the <fen>Danger</fen> threatens.
The place where the <fen>Danger</fen> threatened the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose <fen>Speed</fen> is under consideration.

The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is a function of the distance that the <fen>Entity</fen> moves in a given duration. With the adjectives of this frame this Frame Element is generally incorporated.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s speed.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Speed</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Speed</fen>.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has the <fen>Goods</fen> and wants the <fen>Money</fen>.
<fen>Money</fen> is given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction.
<fen>Goods</fen> is anything including labor or time, for example, which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
listRoleExamples: There is a locked padlock that guarantees <fex>the information</fex> is secure.
Our system ensures that information stored within hardware is secure <fex>from external software attack and physical theft</fex>.
We make sure your BMW is secure <fex>against intruders</fex>.

Israel is insecure <fex>today</fex> not because it does
not have enough military power.
Workers need to make sure their property is secure <fex>at work</fex>.
Barney used to travel <fex>by bus </fex> a lot
<fex>The tabloid's deal with the woman</fex> shielded Schwarzenegger.

Other nations tended to muffle or modulate their occasional annoyance with the
country that was their shield <fex>against the Soviet threat</fex>.
Almost 10 years later, that agreement insulated <fex>Microsoft</fex> from liability on copyright claims over the graphical user interface (GUI).
Regardless of the distribution media, USPTO information is safeguarded <fex>before, during, and after dissemination</fex> from improper access and modification.
To make his way on a foreign soil, he needed different guardians from those that protected him <fex>in his own birthplace</fex> .
She was considered a <fex>purchaser</fex> of the finest things
<fex>My local grocery store</fex> raised prices on meat
The price of the sweater was <fex> $50</fex>.
She was considered a purchaser <fex>of the finest things</fex>
